title: Understanding Gibbs Free Energy Change
text: The Gibbs free energy change (ΔG) for any process is calculated using the formula $$ΔG=\Delta H-T \Delta S$$.

title: Step 1: Calculate Gibbs Free Energy Change
text: First, calculate ΔG using the given values for ΔH, T, and ΔS.

title: Step 2: Calculate for $$2.50$$ mol of water
text: Energy is required for $$1$$ mole, so for $$2.50$$ moles, multiply ΔG by $$2.50$$.

title: Result: Calculate Total Gibbs Free Energy
text: Calculate the total Gibbs free energy change for $$2.50$$ mol of water at $$350$$ K.
